title: std docs settings page logo link goes to `test` crate

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I've just noticed a rather bizarre bug:

- Go to [doc.rust-lang.org/std](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std)
- Click the Settings gear
- Then click the Rust logo in the top-left of the page
- Observe that you have been taken to [doc.rust-lang.org/test](https://doc.rust-lang.org/test)
  (the docs for the `test` crate)

I'm guessing the issue is that the settings page is at `/settings.html` (because
the settings are global across all of the standard library crates), so it's
picking arbitrarily. But it's a bit of a weird choice: why the `test` crate?
Maybe because it's the last crate alphabetically?

I think ideally it would go to `/std` instead.

-----

This may be somewhat unrelated, but I also noticed that the compiler API docs
(at `/nightly/nightly-rustc`) have a weird logo link target even when not on the
settings page: it goes to the `rustdoc` API docs. This one I really don't
understand because the last crate alphabetically is `rustdoc_json_types`, not
`rustdoc`.
